intro: Arnica laevigata, commonly known as smooth arnica, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Arnica laevigata is often found in dry meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
